summary: Youth in foster care may often change schools, which can impair academic achievement. Federal law seeks to improve their educational stability. For example, it requires states to ensure youth stay in the original school they attended before being placed with a new family, unless doing so isn’t in their best interest. State agency officials told us local staff turnover and the cost of transporting students...
title: Foster Care: Education Could Help States Improve Educational Stability for Youth in Foster Care
